concept.title: Configuring and Using the Compact Utility with Chrome Profile

conbody.p: The next steps help you associate your Chrome Profile with the Spy, Record, and Smart Wait functions in Katalon Studio.
To configure and use Katalon Compact Utility, you need to update the Desired Capabilities. Do as follows:

ol.li: Go to Project > Settings > Desired Capabilities.
In the Desired Capabilities section, select Web UI > Chrome.
Click Add to create a new capability named args, for which the type is List.

li.p: To add elements to your list, in the Value column of the capability you've created, click on the ... button.
The List Properties Builder dialog appears. Click Add to create two elements as below. When you are done, click OK to save.

p.b: Finding your Chrome Profile in the User Data Directory

note.p: There are multiple Profiles in a given User Data Directory. To find the name of a Chrome Profile, do as follows:

ul.li: Open Chrome with the Profile you previously used to install Katalon Compact Utility. In the address bar, type chrome://version and press Enter.
The line Profile Path displays the path to your active Profile. For example: C:\Users\your_username\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\User Data\your_profile_name.

ol.li:
To save the Chrome configuration, click Apply and Close.
You can now use the Spy, Record, and Smart Wait features with the default Chrome option.
Using Katalon Compact Utility with Chrome version 103 sometimes my cause the error: unknown error: cannot determine loading status from unknown error: unexpected command response. This issue is addressed in ChromeDriver release notes, and it will be fixed in Chrome version 104 onwards. You can still close the error dialog in Katalon Studio and save your script as normal. To learn more, see ChromeDriver documentation: Current Releases.
.
